definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: This is what we lack the backbone Cheng.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我們阿城人缺少的骨氣。

sentences.english: Dreams of us together, then I was spineless laugh awake.
sentences.chinese: 夢到我們在一起了，然後我就很沒有骨氣的笑醒了。

sentences.english: Tom behaved himself like a man.
And in the face of danger we are showing our character.
sentences.chinese: 我們在困難面前顯示了骨氣。

sentences.english: For people, to endure humiliation is another moral integrity.
sentences.chinese: 爲了人民的事業，忍辱負重，也是另一種骨氣。

sentences.english: My supervisor is a spineless person.
sentences.chinese: 我的主管是一個沒骨氣的人。

sentences.english: The display of backbone helped India strengthen its relationship with Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 印度表現出的這種骨氣幫助它加強了與越南的關係。

definition: lit. able to support both heaven and earth/of indomitable spirit (idiom)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
to admire talented people/to value talent
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
